Package aom.scripting.xs.xs

Class Vector

Object
Vector
public class Vector
extends Object
This class provides a collection of XS commands concerning Vectors. A vector represents a point in 3D space. The X-component is oriented along the South-East map side. The Y-component represents the elevation. The Z-component is oriented along the South-West map side.
Author:
Mythic_Freak - mythic.freak[a]gmail.com

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    vector vector​(float x, float y, float z)
    Creates a simple vector where all three coordinates are literal numbers [like vector(1,2,3), but not vector(x,0,z)].
    float xsVectorGetX​(vector v)
    Returns the x component of the given vector.
    float xsVectorGetY​(vector v)
    Returns the y component of the given vector.
    float xsVectorGetZ​(vector v)
    Returns the z component of the given vector.
    float xsVectorLength​(vector v)
    Returns the length of the given vector.
    vector xsVectorNormalize​(vector v)
    Returns the normalized version of the given vector, i.e.
    vector xsVectorSet​(float x, float y, float z)
    Creates a new vector from three coordinates.
    vector xsVectorSetX​(vector v, float x)
    Set the x component of the given vector, returns the new vector.
    vector xsVectorSetY​(vector v, float y)
    Set the y component of the given vector, returns the new vector.
    vector xsVectorSetZ​(vector v, float z)
    Set the z component of the given vector, returns the new vector.

  • Method Details

    • vector

      public vector vector​(float x, float y, float z)
      Creates a simple vector where all three coordinates are literal numbers [like vector(1,2,3), but not vector(x,0,z)]. Use xsVectorSet to create a vector from any kind of values, including literals, variables, function calls, etc.
      See Also:
      xsVectorSet(float, float, float)

    • xsVectorGetX

      public float xsVectorGetX​(vector v)
      Returns the x component of the given vector.

    • xsVectorGetY

      public float xsVectorGetY​(vector v)
      Returns the y component of the given vector.

    • xsVectorGetZ

      public float xsVectorGetZ​(vector v)
      Returns the z component of the given vector.

    • xsVectorSetX

      public vector xsVectorSetX​(vector v, float x)
      Set the x component of the given vector, returns the new vector.

    • xsVectorSetY

      public vector xsVectorSetY​(vector v, float y)
      Set the y component of the given vector, returns the new vector.

    • xsVectorSetZ

      public vector xsVectorSetZ​(vector v, float z)
      Set the z component of the given vector, returns the new vector.

    • xsVectorSet

      public vector xsVectorSet​(float x, float y, float z)
      Creates a new vector from three coordinates.

      Contrary to the vector() pseudo-function, here non-literals (e.g. function calls or variables) are allowed too.

    • xsVectorLength

      public float xsVectorLength​(vector v)
      Returns the length of the given vector.

    • xsVectorNormalize

      public vector xsVectorNormalize​(vector v)
      Returns the normalized version of the given vector, i.e. a vector of length one that points in the same direction as the given vector.
